test_scenarios.name: Simple File Creation
test_scenarios.query: Create a text file at {test_root}/simple1/hello.txt with content 'Hello World'

test_scenarios.name: Simple File Read and Analysis
test_scenarios.query: Read {test_root}/simple2/data.txt and count how many lines contain the word 'test'

test_scenarios.name: Flask Web Service
test_scenarios.query: Create a Flask web service in {test_root}/flask_app with endpoints: /hello (returns 'Hello'), /time (returns current time). Use python3 and create requirements.txt

test_scenarios.name: Django Project Init
test_scenarios.query: Create a Django project in {test_root}/django_app with an app named 'blog', configure SQLite database, and create initial migration

test_scenarios.name: Git Repository Setup
test_scenarios.query: Create a git repository in {test_root}/myrepo, add README.md, .gitignore (Python), and make initial commit with message 'Initial commit'

test_scenarios.name: Git Branch Operations
test_scenarios.query: In {test_root}/gitrepo, create a new branch 'feature', add a file feature.txt, commit it, switch back to main, and merge feature branch

test_scenarios.name: Multi-file Refactoring
test_scenarios.query: In {test_root}/codebase, create 5 Python files, then rename all functions named 'old_func' to 'new_func' across all files

test_scenarios.name: Docker Service Deployment
test_scenarios.query: Create a Docker setup for a Python Flask app in {test_root}/docker_app: Dockerfile, docker-compose.yml, app.py with /health endpoint, requirements.txt

test_scenarios.name: File Not Found Error
test_scenarios.query: Read the file {test_root}/nonexistent/missing.txt and handle the error gracefully
test_scenarios.notes: ReAct should better handle exploratory error recovery

test_scenarios.name: Permission Error Handling
test_scenarios.query: Try to write to /root/test.txt and handle permission error appropriately
test_scenarios.notes: ReAct should better adapt to unexpected errors
